intro: Dichapetalum lujae var. letestui, commonly known as the Lujan's dichapetalum, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical or subtropical habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
